title: 115_s2031
content: The "Kisatchie National Forest Land Conveyance Act" authorizes the conveyance of certain Federal land in Louisiana for market value consideration. Definitions include Collins Camp Properties, Secretary of Agriculture, and State of Louisiana. SEC. 4. AUTHORIZATION OF CONVEYANCES, KISATCHIE NATIONAL FOREST, LOUISIANA. Authorization for the Secretary to convey Federal land in Louisiana by quitclaim deed, including competitive sale methods. The land includes specified parcels in Winn Parish. The SW\1/4\ of sec. 4, T. 10 N., R. 5 W., Winn Parish, Louisiana, depicted on a certificate of survey dated March 7, 2007, by Glen L. Cannon, P.L.S. 4436. First Right of Purchase allows Collins Camp Properties to acquire up to 47.92 acres of Federal land comprising the Collins Campsites within sec. 9, T. 10 N., R. 5 W., in Winn Parish. The Collins Campsites in Winn Parish, Louisiana, depicted on a survey by Glen L. Cannon, P.L.S. 4436, and a parcel of Federal land described in subsection (a)(2)(B) may be conveyed under certain terms and conditions by the Secretary to maximize marketability or achieve management objectives. The Secretary may convey Federal land under this Act in the public interest. Consideration for the conveyance shall be in cash equal to the market value determined by an appraisal conducted according to federal standards. The Secretary may convey Federal land under this Act in the public interest, with consideration in cash equal to market value determined by an appraisal conducted according to federal standards. Federal land acquisitions must be approved by the Secretary or conveyed by competitive sale. Hazardous substances disclosure is required in conveyances, but the Secretary is not obligated to remediate or abate the substances. The Act allows the conveyance of Federal land with consideration in cash equal to market value, following federal standards. Hazardous substances disclosure is required in conveyances, but the Secretary is not obligated to remediate or abate the substances. SEC. 5 states that the proceeds from the sale of Federal land will be deposited into a specific fund. SEC. 6 addresses the administration of the Act. As a condition of conveyance of Federal land to Collins Camp Properties, the Secretary must require payment for appraisal costs and administrative/environmental analyses. Collins Camp Properties must provide a written statement from holders of Forest Service special use authorizations agreeing to relinquish their rights when making an offer for land acquisition. The Secretary must require payment for appraisal costs and analyses for the conveyance of Federal land to Collins Camp Properties. Holders of special use authorizations must provide a written statement agreeing to relinquish their rights for the conveyance. If a holder fails to provide authorization, Collins Camp Properties will administer the authorization until it expires.
